page.title: 07LONGFORD MILL
page.content: In Longford there is an old water mill. It is beside Brailsford Brook. The mill is not used any more but sometimes the wheel turns. The water-wheel is an undershot wheel. The mill used to grind flour and chicory. The mill pond is part of Brailsford Brook. There is a small white door at the top of the building. A grown-up would have to bend over to go through it. There is a rope-pully that used to pull sacks up. The mill was rebuilt in 1837. The mill was used as a corn store after it stopped grinding corn. The mill has a very big garden. Now it is a private house.
